Posts.Content: Hi Coley1993 I've had 3 FEC and lost most of my hair though eyebrows still all there. Eye lashes a bit thinner but hanging on XX
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Hi seaspirit44 What a breath of fresh air and joy your post is! Thank You! I love It Just wondering if you'd mind sharing some of your experiences with me. I'm waiting for my appointment for a mastectomy and yet to make a decision around reconstruction, prosthetic or neither??? Also interested to hear about your swimming boob and any others you have and what you think of them.  Thanks...enjoy that beach
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi Karen Thanks so much. That's really helpful. My Oncologist did discuss those options though arranged a follow up with him to discuss again. He seem to be less keen to do the axillary clearance because of the Lymphoedema risk which I'm aware of but looks like the side effect of Radiotherapy to the armpit are also challenging. Do you mind me asking why you felt so sure about  going for full clearance over radiotherapy? Was it to be sure that you get all the cancer? Please only answer if you feel it's ok to do so:) With Love xx
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer spread to Lymph Nodes

Posts.Content: Thanks Bustysusy It's true, I'm usually alert and attentive but I guess I was really expecting to hear it's all gone (which it has.. all 11cm) and when he continued...I must have just gone ..somewhere else! I will check in with Oncologist to clarify. xxx
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer spread to Lymph Nodes

Posts.Content: Hi Jac Thanks for your message. I hope you're managing to find a way of relieving the symptoms  of the lymphoedema. It  feels like a really tough decision to make, though I'm with you in that I need some level of knowledge (as much as can be) that the cancer has gone. I had confirmation that it was fully removed  with the Mastectomy despite being huge. Meeting on Monday to discuss Love xxB
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer spread to Lymph Nodes

Posts.Title: Breast Cancer spread to Lymph Nodes

Posts.Content: Hi Alison Thanks for your reply How are you feeling now? Any signs of Lymphoedema and have you finished your treatment. My initial plan before MX and SNB was Chemo then Radiotherapy to chest wall then pills (tamoxifen I think) for 10 years. In a very brief chat I don't think this has changed Seeing Onco on Monday for treatment plan discussion Lots of love..B
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer spread to Lymph Nodes

Posts.Content: Thanks Karen You sound so positive despite what you've experienced and it really has helped me. BIG congratulations on the Archery achievement.....Great Job. I'm have an appointment with Onco on  Monday to discuss. Love xx B

Posts.Title: Breast Cancer spread to Lymph Nodes

Posts.Content: Hello Can anyone clear something up for me about the Sentinel Lymph Node Biopsy??....It was all clear in my head and now I have had my results my brain has turned to mush and cant seem to understand a thing.  Surgeon removed three lymph nodes during mastectomy surgery and two out of three of these had cancer cells. So, does this means that ONLY two in total are cancer positive OR could the cancer have spread to all the remaining nodes (and of course beyond). In my initial scan the lymph nodes appeared clear.   Thanks in advance for any clarity you can provide xx Much Love

Posts.Title: Breast Cancer spread to Lymph Nodes

Posts.Content: Thank You Alison for you reply. It's been really helpful. I have appointment today and a long list of questions (all clearly written down) though I seem to be swinging form one decision to another and feel I do need some professional input. I do trust my Oncologist which is a good thing!! You seem to be getting along with things and taking a great approach to life's little challenges (or not so little). You're an inspiration!! Took ages for me to finally post something on here, but just reading and feeling a part of this with all these amazing people has been such a lift! with Love B xx
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer spread to Lymph Nodes

Posts.Content: Thanks so much for your reply. Can I ask what your recover time was and the amount of movement/pain you had after surgery. I have been told that I may not require Chemo and HER2 negative. Was yours preventative? So glad I decided to post...been just reading other posts for a couple of weeks. Thanks again

Posts.Title: Breast Cancer spread to Lymph Nodes

Posts.Content: Hello! I will soon be having a full Mastectomy..,,right breast. When the consultant told me this he went on to explain the options which are Mastectomy and reconstruction same time 5 Hour operation. Reconstruction after healing which is around a year No reconstruction and use prosthetic. Has anyone faced these options or had a mastectomy that could share thoughts....  Thanks :)
Posts.Title: Mastectomy Choices....Any Thoughts?

Posts.Content: Thanks Taz88 That's really helped me, I felt the same way about having the reconstruction and it somehow becoming infected. I've tentatively opted for the reconstruction at the same time though I think I need a longer consultation really... Thanks again and best wishes
Posts.Title: Mastectomy Choices....Any Thoughts?

Posts.Content: Hi RoseKen1 I posted a similar message to you when I felt confused over the choices after MX and was met equally with help and wisdom of the people on this group.  I eventually decided to go with an implant and it was the right decision for me. My new boob is a bit wonky at times no nipple and a big scar  (which is smooth now), but  I'm surprised how it just feels part of me now three months on and looks ok in clothes. Good luck with your decision  XX
Posts.Title: Reconstruction or not?

Posts.Content: Hi Purplepants As one of the ladies said it's perfectly Ok to feel apprehensive and nervous in fact every feeling going is OK and to be expected. I had my first chemo nearly two weeks ago and felt very emotional starting it as I had it pushed back twice due to delays with my surgery and I just wanted to make a start (of ridding myself of cancer). I felt extreme nausea for about 12 hours though not actually sick, tired for a few days then kind of ok. Taking each day as it comes and working out what to eat/drink as my taste buds have deserted me. I've tried to go out every day..even if its for 5 minutes and speak to people which makes me feel connected to something other than my next chemo session. Let us know how you get on. this is a great place for support...Best wishes xx
Posts.Title: So anxious....
